abstract: Neil M. Barofsky is shaking up Capitol Hill as he quietly pieces together the most complete historical record of the bailout. His reports are careful but not cautious, challenging some of the most powerful people in Washington and Wall Street.
snippet: Neil M. Barofsky is shaking up Capitol Hill as he quietly pieces together the most complete historical record of the bailout. His reports are careful but not cautious, challenging some of the most powerful people in Washington and Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: Neil M. Barofsky is not a household name like some special investigators of the past — Kenneth Starr during the Clinton administration or Archibald Cox in the Watergate years.

headline.main: An Investigator Presses to Uncover Bailout Abuse

abstract: DealBook rounds up the reactions of the wayward press as Davos 2010 begins.
snippet: DealBook rounds up the reactions of the wayward press as Davos 2010 begins.
lead_paragraph: A new raft of uncertainties face the financial industry as its chieftains head to Davos, Switzerland, this year for the annual World Economic Forum. Last year, survival was at the top of the list. But at the 2010 event, a host of proposed regulatory reforms looms large over the banking industry.

headline.main: Davos in the Media: Whither the Forum in 2010?
